poem:
Title: A Skirmish in DC

Whistle of political winds howl in the capitol,
Impeachment, a hefty stone cast in a noisy brawl.
A tangle of accusations, varied and cynical,
Like spaghetti thrown haphazardly at the thorny wall.
Battle lines smudged between red and blue,
In their chess game, who'll be the pawn, who the mule?
Yet, the sun rises and sets, indifferent, above it all.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "House Democrats accuse Republicans of trying to kill off border deal to help ‘Trump become president again’ – live 5.57pm GMT The day so far Republicans have launched their impeachment inquiry against Alejandro Mayorkas, with a House committee chair saying the homeland security secretary “has willfully and systematically refused to comply with the laws”. Democrats, meanwhile, showed no interest in the charges against Mayorkas, which one lawmaker compared to “throwing spaghetti at the wall and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
